meta.name: mvrr_mod
meta.comment: Below is the basic garden-path effect (in the ambiguous condition) #Prediction (6;%reduced_ambig%) > (6;%unreduced_ambig%) Below is the basic garden-path effect (in the ambiguous condition) plus an effect of reduction #Prediction [(6;%reduced_ambig%) > (6;%unreduced_ambig%)] & [(6;%reduced_ambig%) > (6;%reduced_unambig%)] Below is the basic garden-path effect (in the ambiguous condition) plus an effect of reduction plus an interaction so that unambiguous reduces the effect Below is the highest bar for evaluation: complete elimination of GP effect from morphologically ambiguous verb #Prediction [(6;%reduced_ambig%) > (6;%unreduced_ambig%) ] & [(6;%reduced_unambig%) = (6;%unreduced_unambig%)] Below is what Ethan had but Roger doesn't think it's what we want #Prediction [(6;%reduced_ambig%) > (6;%reduced_unambig%) ] & [(6;%unreduced_ambig%) = (6;%unreduced_unambig%)] """sunk"" is sometimes used as a past-tense mv  but it's sufficiently infrequent relative to ""sank"" that we should be OK"
